meanings.definition: To jump or dive quickly and energetically into water.
meanings.sent1: The kids love to plunge into the pool on hot days.
meanings.sent2: She decided to plunge into the ocean to cool off.
meanings.sent3: As the sun beat down, they couldn't resist the urge to plunge into the refreshing water.
meanings.sent4: The daredevil dared to plunge from the high dive into the deep end of the pool.
meanings.sent5: With a loud splash, he took a daring plunge off the cliff into the crystal-clear lake.

meanings.definition: To fall or drop suddenly and uncontrollably.
meanings.sent1: The hiker accidentally stepped too close to the edge and began to plunge down the steep slope.
meanings.sent2: The stock market can plunge unexpectedly, causing panic among investors.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter managed to plunge headfirst into the cake he was carrying.
meanings.sent4: The darkness seemed to plunge the room into a deep, eerie silence.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster made her stomach plunge as it rapidly descended down the steep track.

meanings.definition: To push or thrust quickly and forcefully.
meanings.sent1: He used all his strength to plunge the shovel into the hard ground.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to plunge the knife into the tough meat to cut it.
meanings.sent3: The strong wind threatened to plunge the boat into the rough waves.
meanings.sent4: The knight prepared to plunge his sword into the dragon's heart.
meanings.sent5: The firefighter had to plunge through the smoke to rescue the trapped family.

meanings.definition: A sudden rapid decrease or fall in value or amount.
meanings.sent1: The market experienced a plunge in prices, causing concern among traders.
meanings.sent2: The sudden plunge in temperature caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plunge in attendance left the event organizers puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The company's stocks took a sharp plunge after the scandal was revealed.
meanings.sent5: The plunge in sales forced the store to offer discounts to attract customers.
